[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_dashboard_link()] [URL Injection] Can an attacker manipulate DASHBOARD_BASE_URL environment variable to redirect users to phishing sites or malicious dashboards that mimic legitimate monitoring interfaces? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_dashboard_link()] [Time Manipulation] Can SystemTime::now() be manipulated through system clock attacks to generate incorrect dashboard time ranges, hiding attack evidence in monitoring data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_dashboard_link()] [Integer Overflow] Can the as_millis() conversion overflow when handling dates far in the future, causing incorrect dashboard links or panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_dashboard_link()] [Query Parameter Injection] Are chain_name and namespace properly URL-encoded before insertion into query parameters, or can special characters break the URL structure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_dashboard_link()] [Hardcoded Credentials] The hardcoded datasource ID 'fHo-R604z' and fixed query parameters suggest a shared monitoring infrastructure - can this be exploited for cross-tenant data access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_for_local_run()] [Namespace Collision] Can multiple local test runs generate identical namespace values using SystemTime::now().as_nanos() due to high-resolution timer limitations, causing metric collisions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_for_local_run()] [Information Disclosure] Does the generated dashboard link containing namespace and chain_name get logged or exposed in ways that allow correlation of anonymous test runs with specific users or organizations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_worker_thread()] [Silent Failure] When PUSH_METRICS_ENDPOINT is not set, the function returns None and metrics are silently disabled - can this hide attack activity if an attacker unsets this variable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_worker_thread()] [Error Handling] Invalid PUSH_METRICS_FREQUENCY_SECS values cause the function to return None - can an attacker intentionally break metrics collection by setting invalid values to evade monitoring? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: worker()] [Timing Attack] Can the predictable push timing (based on push_metrics_frequency_secs) be exploited to time attacks during metric transmission windows when validator CPU is busy? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: worker()] [Resource Starvation] If metric encoding and network transmission take longer than push_metrics_frequency_secs, can metrics accumulate and cause memory exhaustion or dropped metrics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: Drop::drop()] [Shutdown Race] The #[allow(deprecated)] attribute on drop() suggests concerns about drop behavior - can the quit signal be lost during rapid initialization/teardown cycles? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: worker()] [Final Push Race] The 'final push' after quit signal is received happens without timeout protection - can a hung network request during shutdown cause validator node hang during critical restart scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: push()] [Information Leakage] Do error logs from failed push attempts expose sensitive information about internal validator configuration, network topology, or operational details? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: join()] [Error Suppression] Are errors from quit_sender.send() and worker_thread.join() properly propagated, or can critical thread failures be silently ignored during shutdown? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: push()] [Log Injection] Can an attacker inject malicious content into logs through the push_metrics_endpoint parameter that exploits log parsing systems or SIEM tools? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: push()] [TLS Validation] Does the ureq client properly validate TLS certificates when connecting to HTTPS endpoints, or can man-in-the-middle attacks intercept metric data and API tokens? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: push()] [HTTP Downgrade] Can an attacker perform SSL stripping attacks to downgrade HTTPS connections to HTTP, exposing API tokens and sensitive metrics in cleartext? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: push()] [Response Size Limit] Is there a maximum response size limit to prevent malicious pushgateway servers from sending huge responses that exhaust memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-push-metrics/src/lib.rs] [Function: push()] [Performance Degradation] Can slow or unresponsive push endpoints cause validator performance degradation during critical consensus operations, affecting block proposal or voting timeliness? (High)
